bill_title: provide for the imposition of civil penalties for failure to timely file certain workers' compensation reports.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the imposition of civil penalties for failure to timely file certain workers' compensation reports. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 62-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If an insurer or employer fails to file with the Department of Labor any report required by this chapter in the manner and within the time limitations prescribed, or otherwise fails to provide a report required by this section in the manner provided by this section, the Department of Labor shall impose a civil penalty of five hundred dollars for each failure. Notice of such penalty imposed shall be made to the party which is in noncompliance by the department on a form prescribed by the department. Any person who violates the filing provisions of this section is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 62-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The imposition of a penalty may be appealed to the secretary of the Department of Labor within thirty days of notice of the penalty. Section 3. That chapter 62-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Monies collected by the state pursuant to section 1 of this Act shall be paid into the state treasury for deposit into an assigned risk safety account.
